subject: Sales
title: Emotional Triggers at the Table
description: A quick win: understand Emotional Triggers at the Table.

hook.text: A negotiator mocks your proposal. You snap back angrily. You just lost the deal without knowing it.

buildup.text: Emotions are weapons at the table. Anger, flattery, and sympathy all serve a tactical purpose.

discovery.text: Anger makes you reactive. Flattery makes you generous. Fear makes you rush. All by design.

twist.text: The best defense is awareness. If you feel a surge of emotion, pause and ask: was that intentional?

climax.text: Step away if emotions run hot. A five-minute break resets the brain and restores clarity.

punchline.text: When emotions rise, judgment falls. Pause first.

quiz.question: How should you respond to emotional triggers at the negotiation table?
options: Pause and assess if it's intentional
